lexUnit.name: urge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: strongly suggest that someone do something

sentence.text: “ Go on , ” she urged .
` Drink some of this tea , " Maggie urged , handing it to Laura .
` This is nineteen forty seven Moll , not the dark ages , " he urged .
` Hush , my treasure , " I urged , ` Pas devant ! "
` Please , " Melissa urged , ` there 's no need to say any more , " but Madame Gebrec continued as if she had not spoken .
` Believe it , Hilary , " he urged gently , and when she smiled he whispered , ` Can we go back to bed now ? "
` Wait for me , " she urged .
` Well , go out and win it ! " urged Beegee .
` Come on , slowcoach , " urged George .
` Think what you see ! " urged Sergeant Juron .
` Tell the world , " urged the citizens at the barricades .
` Ah , come on , Maria , " urged Florian .

Since the Gulf crisis , Western governments have urged their industries to refrain from selling enrichment and other nuclear equipment to Iran .

QN : Did Sharon urge the US leader to keep pressing Iran to give up its nuclear program altogether ?
